intro: Lippia baumii var. baumii, commonly known as Mexican blue sage, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, silver-gray foliage and showy, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in ornamental gardening for its ornamental value and pleasant fragrance. The leaves are used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb in some regions.
